messages.title: Change that works
messages.content: Fair taxes for all, A fair & sustainable economy, Stand-up for Bristol and its communities

keyPolicies.policyDescription: No tax on the first £10,000 you earn, lifting three million people out of income tax altogether and giving most workers a £700 tax cut. Reform the unfair Council Tax and introduce a mansion tax on properties worth over £2 million. Increase tax on pollution to pay for investment in the environment and high-speed rail links. Tax nationalised bank profits to reduce Britain’s debt.

Investment in high-tech green industries and green jobs to pull Britain out of recession. More apprenticeships for young people to ensure that Britain has skills needed for a sustainable economy. Strong commitment to cutting carbon and increasing localised energy supplies in Bristol.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Stephen Williams or Gordon Brown's Labour candidate can win here. The Conservatives are THIRD and have no councillors in Bristol West. A vote for the Conservatives or a minor party risks letting Labour back.

issues.economy: Investment in high-tech green industries and green jobs to pull Britain out of recession. More apprenticeships for young people to ensure that Britain has skills needed for a sustainable economy. Strong commitment to cutting carbon and increasing localised energy supplies in Bristol.
issues.environment: Increase tax on pollution to pay for investment in the environment and high-speed rail links.

housing.content: Reform the unfair Council Tax and introduce a mansion tax on properties worth over £2 million.

quotes.text: Labour governments should not be in the business of taxing the poorest.
Labour's cuts would be tougher than Thatcher's.
"Labour's cuts would be tougher than Thatcher's."
"I want us to meet this test of courage. The shakeup task."
quotes.source: Gordon Brown, Speech to the City of London, Bankers, June 2004

images.caption: Fair taxes for all, A fair & sustainable economy, Stand-up for Bristol and its communities
